str2: Of Hebrew origin; properly, firm, i.e. trustworthy; adverbially, surely.
Of Hebrew origin; properly, firm, i.e. trustworthy; adverbially, surely.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: (a) I say, speak; I mean, mention, tell, (b) I call, name, especially in the pass., (c) I tell, command.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative 2nd Person Singular
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 1st Person Plural
str2: A prolonged form of an otherwise obsolete verb; to talk, i.e. Utter words.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Accusative Neuter Singular
Verb - Perfect Indicative Active - 1st Person Plural
Verb - Present Indicative Active - 1st Person Plural
str2: To witness, bear witness, give evidence, testify, give a good report. From martus; to be a witness, i.e. Testify.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Accusative Neuter Singular
Verb - Perfect Indicative Active - 1st Person Plural
str2: Properly, to stare at, i.e. to discern clearly; by extension, to attend to; by Hebraism, to experience; passively, to appear.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: (a) I receive, get, (b) I take, lay hold of.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Plural
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
Witness, evidence, testimony, reputation. From martus; evidence given.
